page.title: 15Preston Park
page.content: Preston Park, a large and pleasant expanse of 67 acres, some 2 miles north of Brighton, was bought by Brighton Corporation in 1883 for Â£50,000 from Mr and Mrs Stanford. At the northern end of the park stands Preston Manor, a house built on the site of a previous Manor. It was given its present Georgian form in 1738 by Thomas Western, Lord of the Manor of Preston. The house is open to the public and is well worth a visit. You will see beautiful furniture and a valuable collection of china dogs. In the grounds of the Manor are the graves of the Stanford family pets. Each one has an interesting inscription.
